release.action: Point the download URL's to the google code website instead so people that check out the code can instantly build it their selves.
Changed the postgresql data base used in the test into an in memory one so people that check out the code can instantly build it their selves.

Point the maven repository URL's to www.dizizid.com which points to the development server so people that want to contribute can do that much easier by providing their IP address so they are allowed to deploy artifacts on the Nexus maven respository.

Fixed linux issue by renaming the install directory of the downloaded container .ZIP file to the predefined container home directory. Now it doesn't matter what name the .ZIP file has that contains the container.
Added support for the Jetty servlet container.
Added support for the JOnas application server.

Added auto detection of configuration files for the JBoss container utility. Now you don't have to write code to copy properties files and data source XML files. These will be picked up directory in a predefined directory.
Removed Java 6 API calls to be compatible with Java 5. The isEmpty() call from the String class is new in Java 6.
Added the ability to specify the context name of a WAR that will be deployed.
Did some refactoring to avoid null pointer exceptions.
Added the ability to easily create an integration test for applications that don't use a database at all.
Added SQL execution before transaction and after transaction so it's directly available for the web application itself.
Added database generation by Hibernate session factory so you can use your annotated classes to generate your database.
Fixed the stopping of the JBoss container by changing the JNP port to 1299 since cargo is trying to stop it on that port.
Added the functionality to enable you to deploy multiple WAR, EAR or EJB files for a integration test.
Added the basic functionality to create a integration test in an easy way that actually works.
